CatDescriptText: Mr. Walter S. Glenn, 1633 Fifth Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?"  Answer reads: "Yes, I believe that in many cases you just can't get the people to register to ovte [sic]. If we voted more than we do now, we would make much more progress."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Walter S. Glenn wearing eyeglasses and hat, standing on sidewalk of brick street with storefronts in background including Schenley Furniture
